channel.title: US1 - Anypoint Platform Status - Incident History

item.title: Runtime Manager metrics issues
item.content:encoded:
[Medium] - Investigating Missing Ingestion Metrics in Standalone Mule Runtime

Some standalone Mule Runtime customers may be missing ingestion metrics for applications within Runtime Manager. It is not indicated that application performance is impacted, engineers are presently investigating a fix. Summary: Investigating issue with missing ingestion metrics for standalone Mule Runtime customers. No impact on application performance reported.

Mar 15, 17:16 PDT
Investigating - Some standalone Mule Runtime customers may be missing ingestion metrics for applications within Runtime Manager. It is not indicated that application performance is impacted, engineers are presently investigating a fix

item.title: Anypoint Monitoring Center Metrics API Service is experiencing 503 errors.
item.content:encoded:
[High] - Anypoint Monitoring 503 Errors Investigation Summary: Anypoint Monitoring is experiencing a critical issue with the Monitoring Center Metrics API, resulting in significant platform downtime. The cause is being investigated, and further information will be provided as soon as possible.

Mar 11, 12:38 PDT
Investigating - We are investigating an issue where Anypoint Monitoring is returning 503 errors for Monitoring Center Metrics API, we will provide more information as soon as we can.

item.title: MuleSoft Composer Flows Experiencing Intermittent Errors
item.content:encoded:
[High] - Intermittent Error in Composer UI Summary: Composer users may intermittently see an error in the UI when performing a subset of operations like listing of flows and pulling Flow details. Flows already running are not impacted. This suggests a major issue that is causing platform downtime and may have been caused by a configuration change or deployment.

Mar 7, 14:57 PST
Investigating - Composer users may intermittently see an error in the UI when performing a subset of operations like listing of flows and pulling Flow details. Flows already running are not impacted.

item.title: Issue Creating Private Spaces
item.content:encoded:
[High] - Private Space Network Creation Issue Summary: Private Space customers are currently unable to create private networks from the Runtime Manager UI. This major issue is currently being investigated by the team.

Mar 6, 11:26 PST
Investigating - We are currently investigating an issue where Private Space customers are not able to create private networks from Runtime Manager UI.

item.title: Anypoint Platform Release and Maintenance Window
item.content:encoded:
[High] - Scheduled Maintenance for Infrastructure Upgrade

Summary: Scheduled maintenance will be conducted on the underlying infrastructure of the platform. The maintenance will result in service interruptions for various applications and tools such as Nexus, Audit Log, Composer, Anypoint API Manager, and more. Users may experience impact on connection management, policies management, audit log queryability, and deployment and updating functionalities for up to 30 minutes.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Mar 16, 09:00 - 14:00 PDT

Mar 5, 13:01 PST
Scheduled - On Saturday, Mar 16, 2024 between 9AM and 2PM PDT (12PM - 5PM EDT, 4PM - 9PM UTC)


*** ATTENTION: up to 15 min service interruption is expected during this maintenance window … ***

We will be doing scheduled maintenance on part of the platform underlying infrastructure.
*** Service impact details:
* Applications:
- Nexus (https://repository-master.mulesoft.org/nexus/)

During maintenance downtime:
* Runtimes: are not affected
* User Experience (UI): no impact to UI functioning
* API calls: API calls will not be impacted
* Logs and Data: log and metric display data will be updated during the service interruption.

Following maintenance downtime:
* Logs and Data: will appear normal at the end of the update
* Runtimes and all services: will resume normal operation





*** ATTENTION: up to 10 minutes of service interruption is expected during this maintenance window for the following ***

The Audit Log in Anypoint Access Management will experience up to ten minutes of downtime while the database is upgraded during the maintenance window
*** Service Impact Details:
* Applications:
- Audit Log
During maintenance downtime
- Audit logs may not be queryable.
Following maintenance downtime
- Old audit logs will become queryable again. New audit logs may take up to two hours before they become queryable.
- Audit Logs for Telemetry Exporter
During maintenance downtime
- Audit logs export may experience a delay.
Following maintenance downtime
- Audit logs export will resume.

*** ATTENTION: up to 15 minutes of service interruption is expected during this maintenance window for the following ***


We will be doing a scheduled upgrade on part of the platform underlying infrastructure.

*** Service Impact Details:

* Applications:
- Composer
- Anypoint API Manager

During maintenance downtime:
- Composer Flows: connection management will be affected.
- API Manager: policies management will be affected.

Following maintenance downtime:
- Composer Flows: connection management will resume normal operations.
- API Manager: policies management will resume normal operations.

*** ATTENTION: up to 30 minutes of service interruption is expected during this maintenance window. ***


As part of our efforts to enhance our resiliency, performance and availability we are upgrading the database infrastructure. Consequently, there may be an impact on the create/update functionality for applications, notifications for a duration of up to 30 minutes.

*** Service Impact Details:
* Applications:
- Runtime Manager
- API Manager
- Design Center
- Scheduler
- Notifications
During maintenance downtime:
- Runtimes: will not be impacted
- User Interface (UI): Deploying and updating CloudHub applications will not be achievable for up to 30 minutes.
- API calls: Deploying and updating CloudHub applications will not be achievable for up to 30 minutes.
- Design Center Design Center test experience will be degraded for up to 30 minutes.
- Scheduler Application schedules can be delayed by up to 30 minutes.
NotificationsCloudHub notifications and custom notifications in runtime will be will not be created/triggered up to 30 minutes
- Logs and Data: will not be impacted

Following maintenance downtime:
- User Interface (UI): Deploying and updating CloudHub applications will work as usual.
- API calls: Deploying and updating CloudHub applications will work as usual.
- Design Center Design Center test experience will be as usual.
- SchedulerApplication schedules will resume again.
NotificationsCloudHub notifications and custom notifications in runtime will work as usual.
- Logs and Data: will work as usual.


*** ATTENTION: Retirement of Services***


*** Service impact details:
* Applications:
- Flow Designer
Will be retired as it has reached its End-Of-Life on Feb 28th as it was announced on Feb 22nd 2023.

item.title: API Manager is failing to apply new policies to applications.
item.content:encoded:
[High] - Error Impacting Customer Applications Summary: Customers may experience errors while applying new policies to existing and new applications. Our teams are investigating.

Mar 4, 14:56 PST
Investigating - Customers may experience errors while using applying new policies to existing and new applications. Our teams are investigating.

item.title: Retroactive Post: UI options missing Partner Manager
item.content:encoded:
[High] - Partner Manager Navigation Issue

Customers experienced a significant issue where they were unable to navigate or view options within Partner Manager for over an hour. The problem was resolved by the engineering teams.

Mar 4, 12:12 PST
Resolved - We experienced an issue from 2024-03-04 18:18 UTC (10:18 AM PST) to 19:43 UTC (11:43AM PST) , where customers were not able to navigate or view options within Partner Manager. Our engineering teams have resolved this issue and are taking the necessary steps to prevent such issues in the future.

item.title: Jira connector creation issues
item.content:encoded:
[High] - Major Impact on Creation of New Flows with Jira Connector Summary: A fix has been implemented to address the issue of new flows being created with the Jira connector, and monitoring of the results is ongoing. The issue was identified as a major disruption.

Feb 28, 16:29 PST
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Feb 28, 16:16 PST
Identified - Creation of new flows with Jira connector is impacted

item.title: Partner Manager V2 Acknowledgement Reconciliation and Transaction Replays delays.
item.content:encoded:
[High] - Partner Manager V2 Acknowledgement Reconciliation and Transaction Replays Experiencing Delays

We are investigating an issue on which Partner Manager V2 Acknowledgement Reconciliation and Transaction Replays are experiencing delays, we will provide more information as soon as we can. Summary: Investigating delays in Partner Manager V2 Acknowledgement Reconciliation and Transaction Replays.

Feb 28, 10:50 PST
Investigating - We are investigating an issue on which Partner Manager V2 Acknowledgement Reconciliation and Transaction Replays are experiencing delays, we will provide more information as soon as we can.

item.title: Customers may experience problems with Runtime Manager
item.content:encoded:
[Medium] - Performance Degradation on MuleSoft Service Summary: Users are reporting suboptimal performance while accessing the MuleSoft service. Our teams are currently investigating the issue.

Feb 28, 00:50 PST
Investigating - Users can access the MuleSoft service, but some functionality can be running at less than optimal performance. Our teams are investigating.

item.title: Logs and Metrics Failing to show in Monitoring
item.content:encoded:
[Medium] - Potential Impact on VPN Traffic for Some 4.6 and Cloud Hub 2 Customers Identified

We have identified an issue where some 4.6 and Cloud Hub 2 customers also have VPN traffic that does not allow sending traffic to new ingestion endpoints and may not see logs and metrics in their monitoring. Summary: Feb 23, 11:40 PST - We have identified an issue where some 4.6 and Cloud Hub 2 customers also have VPN traffic that does not allow sending traffic to new ingestion endpoints and may not see logs and metrics in their monitoring.

Feb 23, 11:40 PST
Identified - We have identified an issue where some 4.6 and Cloud Hub 2 customers also have VPN traffic that does not allow sending traffic to new ingestion endpoints and may not see logs and metrics in their monitoring.

item.title: Anypoint Platform Release and Maintenance Window
item.content:encoded:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Mar 2, 09:00 - 14:00 PST

Feb 19, 16:26 PST
Update - We will be undergoing scheduled maintenance during this time.

Feb 19, 16:26 PST
Update - We will be undergoing scheduled maintenance during this time.

Feb 19, 16:25 PST
Update - We will be undergoing scheduled maintenance during this time.

Mar 2, 09:00 PST
Scheduled - US: On Saturday, Mar 2, 2024 between 9AM and 2PM PDT (12PM - 5PM EDT, 5PM - 10PM UTC)

New/Enhanced Feature Releases


Bug fixes & back-end performance enhancement releases



*** ATTENTION: a 15 to 30 min service interruption is expected during this maintenance window … ***

We will be performing a scheduled upgrade on part of the platform’s underlying infrastructure.
*** Service impact details:
* Applications:
- Runtime Manager
This interruption affects only Runtime Fabric and Cloud Hub 2.0. Flex Gateway and Standalone Servers are not impacted. During the service interruption, there will be no impact to the applications.
During maintenance downtime:
* Runtimes: are not impacted.
* User Experience(UX): On the Runtime Fabric and Private Space Status pages, RTF Agents might show as “Degraded” status. Customers might not be able to deploy applications to their existing RTF Agents and Private Spaces. Registration of new RTF Agents and Private Spaces will take longer than usual to achieve "Active” status. This will be temporary and fixed after the maintenance window has been completed.
* API calls: API calls will not be impacted
* Logs and Data: log and metric display data will be updated during the service interruption.




Customer Impacting / Downtime Announcement(s)

***ATTENTION: up to 1 hour of service interruption is expected during this maintenance window.***

We will be performing a scheduled upgrade of an internal database.
*** Service Impact Details:
** Applications:
Mocking Service
During Maintenance Downtime:
* Existing Runtimes: are not impacted.
* User Experience(UX): Mocking Service calls from API Designer, Exchange and API Community Manager (ACM) will fail due to Mocking Service being unavailable
* API Calls: REST APIs calls for Mocking Service will not be accessible as the service will be unavailable


*** ATTENTION: up to 60 minutes of service interruption is expected during this maintenance window for the following ***


We will be doing a scheduled upgrade on part of the platform underlying infrastructure.

*** Service Impact Details:
* Applications:
- Anypoint Runtime Manager
During maintenance downtime:
- Runtimes: CloudHhub CPU / Memory alerts will be delayed during the maintenance window. In addition, CloudHub Applications utilizing the Auto-scaling feature, will not be able to scale up or scale down, during the maintenance window.
- User Interface (UI): will not be impacted.
- API calls: will not be impacted.
- Logs and Data: will not be impacted
- Following maintenance downtime:
- Runtimes and all services: will resume normal operation.



ATTENTION: up to 1 hour of service interruption is expected.

We will be performing a scheduled upgrade of an internal database.
*** Service Impact Details:
** Applications:
- Anypoint Exchange
- Anypoint DataGraph
- Anypoint API Manager
- Anypoint API Governance
- Cloudhub
- API Catalog
* User Experience(UX): User Interface (UI) will display errors when:
- DataGraph: users deploy Datagraph instances, which will remain on status "on hold"
- API Manager: users submit new policies or publish new assets like API specs. Also, when users try to create a Policy Template.
- API Governance: users try to update rulesets in Exchange.
- Cloudhub: users try to create new CloudHub 2.0 schedulers.
- API Catalog: users publish their API Specifications using the command line.
* API Calls: REST API calls for asset publication won't work.
* Existing Runtimes: are not impacted.

*** ATTENTION: 60 minutes of service interruption is expected during this maintenance window for the following ***

We will be doing a scheduled upgrade on part of an internal database.

*** Service Impact Details:
** Applications:
- Anypoint Partner Manager V2 (APMv2)
* User Experience(UX): Users will not be able to access Partner Manager v2 during this upgrade
* API Calls: Platform APIs for Partner Manager will not be accessible
* Existing Runtimes: Processing of B2B transactions in the runtime applications deployed by Partner Manager will NOT be impacted



***ATTENTION: up to 4 hours of service interruption is expected during this maintenance window.***


We will be performing database maintenance.

*** Service Impact Details:
** Applications:
Anypoint Monitoring
Visualizer
During Maintenance Downtime:
- Anypoint platform users may not be able to use Anypoint monitoring
- Anypoint Platform users may not be able to deploy new apps or restart existing apps
- Visualizer users may not be able to use Visualizer.





59291521
*** ATTENTION: up to 30 minutes of service interruption is expected during this maintenance window. ***


As part of our efforts to enhance our resiliency, performance and availability we are upgradting the databases infrastracture. Consequently, there may be an impact on the create/update functionality for applications, notifications for a duration of up to 30 minutes.

*** Service Impact Details:
* Applications:
- Runtime Manager
- API Manager
- Design Center
- Scheduler
- Notifications
During maintenance downtime:
- Runtimes: will not be impacted
- User Interface (UI): Deploying and updating CloudHub applications will not be achievable up to 30 minutes.
- API calls: Deploying and updating CloudHub applications will not be achievable up to 30 minutes.
- Design Center Design Center test experience will be degraded for up to 30 minutes.
- Scheduler Application schedules can be delayed by up to 30 minutes.
NotificationsCloudHub notifications and custom notification in runtime will be will not be created/triggered up to 30 minutes
- Logs and Data: will not be impacted

Following maintenance downtime:
- User Interface (UI): Deploying and updating CloudHub applications will work as usual.
- API calls: Deploying and updating CloudHub applications will will work as usual.
- Design Center Design Center test experience will be as usual.
- SchedulerApplication schedules will resume again.
NotificationsCloudHub notifications and custom notification in runtime will work as usual.
- Logs and Data: will work as usual.

item.title: Anypoint Platform Release and Maintenance Window
item.content:encoded:
Feb 17, 14:00 PST
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Feb 17, 09:00 PST
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Feb 7, 10:31 PST
Scheduled - On Saturday, Feb 17, 2024 between 9AM and 2PM PST (12PM - 5PM EST, 5PM - 10PM UTC)

Bug fixes & back-end performance enhancement releases


Anypoint Webserver
- OAuth Client System (OCS) implementing rate limiting policy - an internal service to create OAuth connections in MS Composer.

Dataloader.io
- Implementing rate and size request limits to prevent abusing application endpoints. No impact for normal usage through the web.


Customer Impacting / Downtime Announcement(s)


*** ATTENTION: up to 2 hours of service interruption is expected during this maintenance window for the following ***

We will be doing a scheduled upgrade on Access Management database.
*** Service Impact Details:
* Applications:
- Access Management
During maintenance downtime
- Anypoint users will be able to login to their account and view information in Access Management, but may not be able modify information until the scheduled downtime is complete.
- Anypoint clients will be able to get new tokens, and call read APIs in Access Management, but may not be able to call write APIs until the scheduled downtime is complete.
- Any tokens obtained 1 hour prior to the downtime window will not expire until the end of the downtime window.
- Any tokens obtained during the downtime window will work, but may suddenly expire. When that happens, please login or request a new token.
- API calls to Access Management may error out.
Following maintenance downtime
- Access Management will function as usual
- Help Center will function as usual
Additionally, the following services will be impacted and in degraded states during this change. It is recommended that customers treat the following services as degraded during this window:
- API Designer
- API Analytics
- API Monitoring Center
- API Functional Monitoring
- Audit Log
- Composer (MuleSoft and Salesforce)
- Design Center Projects
- API Mocking Service
- OAuth Client System
- Anypoint MQ
- Anypoint Metering
- Runtime Fabric
- Runtime Manager
- RPA
- Anypoint Partner Manager v2
- Object Store V2
- Trusted Domains
- Universal Management Platform
- Existing running applications won't see any impact. If an existing (MQ or OSv2 app) got restarted during the maintenance, it won't be impacted either.
- Customers won't be able to deploy new MQ and OSv2 apps when Auth Service database is in RO mode as authentication tokens can't be generated.

*** ATTENTION: up to 4 hours of service interruption is expected during this maintenance window ***

We will be performing database maintenance.
*** Service Impact Details:
** Applications:
Anypoint Monitoring
Visualizer
During Maintenance Downtime:
- Anypoint platform users may not be able to use Anypoint monitoring
- Anypoint Platform users may not be able to deploy new apps or restart existing apps
- Visualizer users may not be able to use Visualizer.

*** ATTENTION: up to 60 minutes of service interruption is expected during this maintenance window ***

We will be performing a scheduled update Vulnerability Remediation of an internal database for email notifications
*** Service impact details:
** Applications:
Runtime Manager
API Manager
Composer
During maintenance downtime:
* User Experience(UX): Email notification system will be unavailable.

*** ATTENTION: up to 60 minutes of service interruption is possible during this maintenance window ***

We will be performing a scheduled upgrade on part of the platform's underlying infrastructure.
*** Service impact details:
* Applications:
- Monitoring Center
During maintenance downtime:
This potential interruption will only affect Alerts. New and existing alerts status changes (including alert triggering) may be delayed until downtime is concluded.
* User Experience(UX): Monitoring Center alerts may not be triggered.

*** ATTENTION: up to 60 minutes of service interruption is expected ***

Exchange will be performing an increase of the size of an internal database.
*** Service Impact Details:
* Applications:
- Exchange
During maintenance downtime:
- Runtimes: are not affected.
- User Interface (UI): will show “Unable to complete this request while services are undergoing maintenance. Please retry after maintenance has been completed.” when doing certain operations.
- API calls: to these services will return Service Unavailable Error (503). GET RequestsRequest will not be affected.
- Logs and Data: will continue to be collected.
Following maintenance downtime:
- Logs and Data: will appear as usual.
- Runtimes and all services: will resume normal operation.

item.title: Anypoint MQ Broker intermittently returning 5xx errors
item.content:encoded:
Feb 14, 17:31 PST
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Feb 14, 17:11 PST
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Feb 14, 17:05 PST
Identified - The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Feb 14, 15:56 PST
Update - We are continuing to investigate this issue.

Feb 14, 15:42 PST
Update - We are continuing to investigate this issue.

Feb 14, 14:34 PST
Investigating - We are currently investigating this issue.

item.title: Issue with usage reports in CloudHub 2.0
item.content:encoded:
Feb 13, 12:06 PST
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Jan 22, 13:58 PST
Identified - Customers running Mule apps on CloudHub 2.0 who are monitoring usage in the usage reports may observe missing Network Bytes data from September 2023 onward

item.title: A small number of customers may experience errors while accessing ObjectStore v2 in the US East Region for runtimes.
item.content:encoded:
Feb 12, 00:52 PST
Resolved - As of 12:37 AM Pacific time the incident was mitigated and has been resolved.

Feb 12, 00:37 PST
Monitoring - Engineering teams have implemented a fix and we are monitoring the services.

Feb 12, 00:27 PST
Investigating - Our engineering team is continuing to work to address the issue and restore service to its expected state.

Feb 11, 23:41 PST
Identified - Customers may experience 503 errors while using ObjectStore V2. Engineering teams are investigating and putting measures in place to reduce the impact/resolve the issue. No customer action is required at this point.

Feb 11, 22:57 PST
Investigating - A small number of customers may experience errors while accessing ObjectStore V2 in the US East region for runtimes.

item.title: Customers may experience problems with API Analytics showing incomplete data
item.content:encoded:
Feb 8, 18:12 PST
Resolved - As of 5:58 PM Pacific time API Analytics ingestion returned to normal operation. The cause of the performance situation was identified and has been resolved. Operations for API Analytics are back within expected performance.

Feb 8, 17:58 PST
Monitoring - Engineering teams have implemented a fix and we are monitoring the services.

Feb 8, 17:41 PST
Investigating - Customers may experience problems with API Analytics showing incomplete data. Our teams are investigating.

item.title: CloudHub 1 Business Group Runtime Options not visible
item.content:encoded:
Feb 7, 17:27 PST
Resolved - The issue was resolved at 17:26 PT. We will be providing an RCA via our support portal in the next 5 business days.

Feb 7, 13:47 PST
Identified - This issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented. A work around has been found for some customers.
If you have Global Deployments for your org, please enable "Global Deployments" for your corresponding suborg (https://help.mulesoft.com/s/article/Set-Global-Deployments-on-Business-Groups).

Note: API and Maven deployments are not affected.

Feb 7, 13:12 PST
Investigating - Some customers may be experiencing issues seeing Runtime options when deploying CloudHub 1 applications in Runtime Manager.

item.title: Anypoint Platform Release and Maintenance Window
item.content:encoded:
Feb 3, 11:29 PST
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Feb 3, 09:00 PST
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Jan 23, 09:57 PST
Scheduled - On Saturday, Feb 3, 2024 between 9AM and 2PM PDT (12PM - 5PM EDT, 4PM - 9PM UTC)

*** ATTENTION: a 30 min to 1 hour service interruption is expected during this maintenance window … ***

We will be performing a scheduled upgrade on part of the platform's underlying infrastructure. We are introducing a new set of static IP addresses in Runtime Manager that will augment the existing ones. For more information, visit the KB: New IP addresses in Runtime Manager 2024 February page (https://help.mulesoft.com/s/article/New-IP-addresses-in-Runtime-Manager-2024-February)
*** Service impact details:
* Applications:
- Runtime Manager
This interruption affects only Standalone Servers. Runtime Fabric, Cloud Hub 2.0, Flex Gateway are not impacted.
During the service interruption, there will be no impact to the applications.
During maintenance downtime:
* Runtimes: are not impacted.
* User Experience(UX): Application management capabilities of Runtime Manager may be disrupted as some servers may be disconnected and become unavailable for management. This will be temporary and the correct state of the Mule applications will be reflected after the maintenance window has been completed.
With the addition of a new set of static IP addresses in Runtime Manager, to avoid service disruption allow the IP addresses or domains (depending on your network policy) through your organization's firewall as listed in the Allow Lists page (https://docs.mulesoft.com/runtime-manager/rtm-agent-allowlists#static-ip-addresses)
* API calls: API calls will not be impacted
* Logs and Data: log and metric display data will be updated during the service interruption.

*** ATTENTION: up to 30 minutes of service interruption is expected during this maintenance window for the following ***


We will be doing a scheduled upgrade on part of the platform underlying infrastructure.

*** Service Impact Details:
* Applications:
- Anypoint Runtime Manager
During maintenance downtime:
- Runtimes: will not be impacted
- User Interface (UI): CloudHub networking tabs (VPC, VPN, DLB, TGW) will throw errors when trying to create/update/delete
- API calls: CloudHub networking components (VPC, VPN, DLB, TGW) will not be manageable
- Logs and Data: will not be impacted
Following maintenance downtime:
- User Interface (UI): CloudHub networking tabs (VPC, VPN, DLB, TGW) will work as usual
- API calls: CloudHub networking components (VPC, VPN, DLB, TGW) will work as usual


*** ATTENTION: up to 45 minutes service interruption is expected during this maintenance window ***

We will be performing a scheduled upgrade on part of the platform's underlying public key infrastructure.
*** Service impact details:
* Applications:
- Runtime Fabric and CH2 spaces
- Anypoint Monitoring
- Flex Gateway
- RPA

During maintenance downtime:

* Runtimes: are not impacted.
* User Experience(UX):
1. Existing Runtime Fabric agents cannot rotate the PKI certificate. New Runtime Fabric installation cannot be created.
2. Anypoint monitoring agent will not be able to renew its mTLS certificate.There is no impact to the usage of existing mTLS certificate to ship the metrics to the Anypoint platform, unless the certificate expires during the maintenance window.
3. mTLS certificate for existing Flex Gateway instances cannot be renewed. Existing Flex Gateway instances cannot be deleted. New Flex Gateway instance cannot be created.
4. RPA manager will only be affected if its multi-tenant infrastructure needs to be expanded to fulfill a new provisioning request during the maintenance window.

* API calls: API calls will not be impacted


*** ATTENTION: a 15 to 30 min service interruption is expected during this maintenance window … ***

We will be performing a scheduled upgrade on part of the platform’s underlying infrastructure.
*** Service impact details:
* Applications:
- Runtime Manager
This interruption affects only Runtime Fabric and Cloud Hub 2.0. Flex Gateway and Standalone Servers are not impacted. During the service interruption, there will be no impact to the applications.
During maintenance downtime:
* Runtimes: are not impacted.
* User Experience(UX): On the Runtime Fabric and Private Space Status pages, Agents might show as “Degraded” status; Customers might not be able to create Runtime Fabric Agents and Private Spaces correctly. This will be temporary and fixed after the maintenance window has been completed.
* API calls: API calls will not be impacted
* Logs and Data: log and metric display data will be updated during the service interruption.

item.title: RTF is in a Degraded State
item.content:encoded:
Feb 2, 12:58 PST
Resolved - As of 12:30 PM PT the issue was resolved, at which point customers are no longer seeing RTF in a degraded state.

Feb 2, 12:35 PST
Identified - The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Feb 2, 12:04 PST
Investigating - We are investigating an issue on where RTF is a Degraded State, we will provide more information as soon as we can.

item.title: CloudHub | January 2024 Runtime and DLB Monthly Patches were not Applied in US Control Plane Automatically
item.content:encoded:
Jan 30, 13:53 PST
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Jan 29, 11:31 PST
Identified - The issue has been identified and a fix/resolution is in the works.

Jan 29, 00:37 PST
Investigating - We are investigating an issue affecting CloudHub Monthly Auto-upgrade, we will provide more information as soon as we can.

Affected Customers are directed to follow the below link - Article Link https://help.mulesoft.com/s/article/CloudHub-January-2024-Runtime-and-DLB-Monthly-Patches-were-not-Applied-in-US-Control-Plane-Automatically

item.title: Environments are Erroring Upon Delete
item.content:encoded:
Jan 25, 14:53 PST
Resolved - As of 14:20 PT (22:20 UTC) the issue has been resolved.

Jan 25, 14:22 PST
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Jan 25, 14:01 PST
Investigating - Customers will experience an error when attempting to delete an environment. Teams are investigating this issue.

item.title: New Templates Unable to be Deployed to Partner Manager
item.content:encoded:
Jan 25, 12:12 PST
Resolved - The recent issues affecting Partner Manager customers on CloudHub have been successfully resolved. Our teams have addressed the problems that were causing failures in the deployment of new message flows and running template upgrades. We also resolved the difficulties impacting transaction replays.

Please note that runtime applications and data processing of already deployed message flows were not impacted during this issue.

We appreciate your patience and understanding while we worked to fix these issues.

Jan 25, 11:34 PST
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Jan 25, 10:59 PST
Update - Deployment of new message flows and running template upgrades are failing for Partner Manager customers using CloudHub. Teams have identified the issue are are working on a fix. This issue also impacts the ability to replay transactions. Runtime applications and data processing of already deployed message flows are not impacted due to this issue.

Jan 25, 09:57 PST
Identified - Deploying new message flows and running template upgrades are failing for Partner Manager customers using Cloudhub. Teams have identified the issue are are working on a fix.

item.title: Customers may experience problems with Composer creating new or opening and modifying existing flows.
item.content:encoded:
Jan 24, 15:12 PST
Resolved - As of 10:56 PM UTC the incident was mitigated the issue has been resolved.

Jan 24, 14:59 PST
Monitoring - Engineering teams have implemented a fix and we are monitoring the services.

Jan 24, 14:45 PST
Investigating - Customers may experience problems when they attempt to create a new flow or open/edit an existing flow in the Composer user interface. There is no impact to running flows.

item.title: API Analytics Data Delayed
item.content:encoded:
Jan 23, 17:57 PST
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Jan 23, 16:16 PST
Update - We are still working on implementing a fix, we will provide more information soon

Jan 23, 14:51 PST
Identified - The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Jan 23, 13:53 PST
Investigating - The API Analytics data may not be showing real-time information for some customers; there is a delay in the data display. Teams are currently investigating.

item.title: Customers may experience problems with MS Anypoint Monitoring
item.content:encoded:
Jan 22, 12:54 PST
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Jan 22, 10:24 PST
Identified - Engineers have identified the cause of the issue and are working towards implementing a fix.

Jan 22, 09:14 PST
Update - We are continuing to investigate this issue.

Jan 22, 07:34 PST
Investigating - Customers may experience problems with MS Anypoint Monitoring. Our teams are investigating.

item.title: Anypoint Platform Release and Maintenance Window
item.content:encoded:
Jan 20, 12:24 PST
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Jan 20, 09:00 PST
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Jan 11, 11:22 PST
Scheduled - US: On Saturday, Jan 20, 2024 between 9AM and 2PM PDT (12PM - 5PM EDT, 4PM - 9PM UTC)


New Enhanced feature release

New metering api endpoints for metering api
Anypoint Webserver
- Added a path for metering future functionality. No impact to existing features

“bug fixes, no downtime anticipated”


***ATTENTION: up to 1 hour of service interruption is expected during this maintenance window. ***

We will be performing a scheduled upgrade of an internal database.
*** Service Impact Details:
** Applications:
Trusted Domains
During Maintenance Downtime:
* Existing Runtimes: are not impacted.
* User Experience (UX): Requests done from Anypoint Platform to external domains through the API Console won't work during the maintenance. Anypoint administrators won't be able to review, add, or delete trusted domains from Access Management.

Customer Impacting / Downtime Announcement(s)

***ATTENTION: up to 60 minutes of service interruption is expected. ***

Exchange will be performing an increase of the size of an internal database.
*** Service Impact Details:
* Applications:
- Exchange
During maintenance downtime:
- Runtimes: are not affected.
- User Interface (UI): will show “Unable to complete this request while services are undergoing maintenance. Please retry after maintenance has been completed.” when doing certain operations.
- API calls: to these services will return Service Unavailable Error (503). GET Requests will not be affected.
- Logs and Data: will continue to be collected.
Following maintenance downtime:
- Logs and Data: will appear as usual.
- Runtimes and all services: will resume normal operation.

Customer Impacting / Downtime Announcement(s)

***ATTENTION: up to 60 minutes of service interruption is expected. ***

We will be performing a scheduled upgrade of an internal database.
*** Service Impact Details:
* Applications:
- Runtime Manager
- API Manager

During maintenance downtime:
* Existing Runtimes: are not impacted.
* User Experience (UX): Platform alerts usage will be interrupted. Servers and applications discrete alerts could be interrupted, and no new alerts will be created. API Manager alerts will not be triggered.


*** ATTENTION: up to 60 minutes of service interruption is expected during this maintenance window for the following ***


We will be doing a scheduled upgrade on part of the platform underlying infrastructure.

*** Service Impact Details:
* Applications:
- Anypoint Runtime Manager
During maintenance downtime:
- Runtimes: will not be impacted
- User Interface (UI): Cloudhub mule messages dashboard will not get updated data until finish.
- API calls: CloudHub Dashboard stats REST API will not get updated information
- Logs and Data: will not be impacted
Following maintenance downtime:
- User Interface (UI): Cloudhub mule messages will be show as usual without data loss
- API calls: CloudHub Dashboard stats REST API will get updated data.

item.title: OpenShift RTF Cert Renewal Issues.

https://help.mulesoft.com/s/article/Runtime-Fabric-Cluster-is-Disconnected-or-Degraded-and-Showing-remote-error-tls-unknown-certificate

Jan 18, 13:26 PST
Investigating - Customers may experience OpenShift RTF Cert renewal issues; teams are investigating the issue.

A fix has been implemented, and we are monitoring the results

item.title: Customers may experience missing usage metrics from API Designer products in Anypoint Exchange
item.content:encoded:
Jan 17, 15:19 PST
Resolved - This issue was resolved at 14:46 PT, after a fix was successfully deployed and validated.

Jan 17, 10:23 PST
Identified - The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Jan 17, 08:55 PST
Investigating - We detected an issue on Anypoint Exchange and API Designer products concerning usage metrics which we're investigating. No impact is expected for customers as of now. A delayed impact may be experienced for some customers, specifically some API Designer usage metrics may not show up in your Exchange dashboards.

Investigating - We are investigating an issue in which some customers may experience delay in receiving new API alerts.

item.title: Anypoint Platform Release and Maintenance Window
item.content:encoded:
Jan 6, 13:34 PST
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Jan 6, 09:00 PST
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Dec 27, 11:18 PST
Scheduled - US: On Saturday, Jan 6, 2024 between 9AM and 2PM PST (12PM - 5PM EDT, 4PM - 9PM UTC)

New/Enhanced Feature Releases


Bug fixes & back-end performance enhancement releases



Customer Impacting / Downtime Announcement(s)


*** ATTENTION: a 15 min to 1 hour service interruption is expected during this maintenance window … ***

We will be performing a scheduled upgrade on part of the platform's underlying infrastructure.
*** Service impact details:
* Applications:
- Runtime Manager
This interruption affects only Standalone Servers. Runtime Fabric, Cloud Hub 2.0, Flex Gateway are not impacted.
During the service interruption, there will be no impact to the applications.
During maintenance downtime:
* Runtimes: are not impacted.
* User Experience(UX): Application management capabilities of Runtime Manager may be disrupted as some servers may be disconnected and become unavailable for management. This will be temporary and the correct state of the Mmule application will be reflected after the maintenance window has been completed.
* API calls: API calls will not be impacted
* Logs and Data: log and metric display data will be updated during the service interruption.

*** ATTENTION: up to 2 hours of service interruption is expected during this maintenance window for the following ***

We will be doing a scheduled upgrade on Access Management database.
*** Service Impact Details:
* Applications:
- Access Management
- Help Center
During maintenance downtime
- Anypoint users will be able to login to their account and view information in Access Management, but may not be able modify information until the scheduled downtime is complete.
- Anypoint clients will be able to get new tokens, and call read APIs in Access Management, but may not be able to call write APIs until the scheduled downtime is complete.
- Any tokens obtained 1 hour prior to the downtime window will not expire until the end of the downtime window.
- Any tokens obtained during the downtime window will work, but may suddenly expire. When that happens, please login or request a new token.
- API calls to Access Management may error out.
- API calls to Access Management may error out.
Following maintenance downtime
- Access Management will function as usual
- Help Center will function as usual
Additionally, the following services will be impacted and in degraded states during this change. It is recommended that customers treat the following services as degraded during this window:
- API Designer
- API Analytics
- API Monitoring Center
- API Functional Monitoring
- Audit Log
- Composer (MuleSoft and Salesforce)
- Design Center Projects
- API Mocking Service
- OAuth Client System
- Anypoint MQ
- Anypoint Metering
- Runtime Fabric
- Runtime Manager
- RPA
- Anypoint Partner Manager v2
- Object Store V2
- Trusted Domains
- Universal Management Platform

- Existing running applications won’t see any impact. If an existing (MQ or OSv2 app) got restarted during the maintenance, it won’t be impacted either.
- Customers won’t be able to deploy new MQ and OSv2 apps when Auth Service database is in RO mode as authentication tokens can’t be generated.

*** ATTENTION: up to 60 minutes of service interruption is expected during this maintenance window ***

We will be performing a scheduled upgrade of an internal database for Anypoint Secrets Manager
*** Service impact details:
* Applications:
- Runtime Manager
- API Manager
- Partner Manager (both v1 and v2)
- Anypoint Security (All components)
- Design Center (Flow Designer, API Designer and Design Center Projects)
- Anypoint Monitoring
- MuleSoft Composer
- MuleSoft Composer for Salesforce
During maintenance downtime:
* User Experience(UX): Anypoint Secrets Manager will be unavailable. User will experience an error for the following applications:
Anypoint Secrets Manager: Customers will not be able to manage secret groups and secrets.
Runtime Manager: Customers will not be able to deploy a new mule application, create a new Runtime Fabric instance, Private Space instance and Tokenization Service.
API Manager: Customers will not be able to add or update APIs using Mule Gateway or Flex Gateway.
Partner Manager: Customers will not be able to create or update endpoints, nor they will be able to deploy new message flows. Also they won’t be able to run template upgrades.
Anypoint Security: Customers will not be able to create or update their security-edge instance and tokenization service.
Design Center: Customers will not be able to perform activities involving Anypoint Secrets Manager.
Anypoint Monitoring: Customers monitors that are using Anypoint Secrets Manager integration in their monitor will fail.
MuleSoft Composer: Customers will not be able to create a new workflow. Existing workflows may also be impacted if it stores or retrieves secrets from Secrets Manager.
MuleSoft Composer for Salesforce: Customers will not be able to activate the workflow
* API calls:
Invoking Anypoint APIs that use Anypoint Secrets Manager will fail.
* Existing Runtimes: are not impacted.
* Following maintenance downtime:
Anypoint Secrets Manager will function as usual

***ATTENTION: up to 2 hours of service interruption is expected during this maintenance window.***

We will be performing database maintenance.
*** Service Impact Details:
** Applications:
Anypoint Monitoring
Visualizer
During Maintenance Downtime:

- Anypoint platform users may not be able to use Anypoint monitoring.
- Visualizer users may not be able to use Visualizer.




*** ATTENTION: a 5 - 10 min service interruption is expected during this maintenance window … ***

We will be doing scheduled maintenance for monitoring Cloud Service.
*** Service impact details:
* Applications:
- Nexus (https://repository.mulesoft.org/nexus/)

During maintenance downtime:
* Runtimes: are not affected
* User Experience (UI): no impact to UI functioning
* API calls: API calls will not be impacted
* Logs and Data: log and metric display data will be updated during the service interruption.

Following maintenance downtime:
* Logs and Data: will appear normal at the end of the update
* Runtimes and all services: will resume normal operation

item.title: Exchange experiencing 500 errors and random slowness.
item.content:encoded:
Jan 3, 16:05 PST
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Jan 3, 15:39 PST
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Jan 3, 14:46 PST
Update - We are continuing to investigate this issue.

Jan 3, 14:29 PST
Update - We are continuing to investigate this issue.

Jan 3, 13:04 PST
Update - We are continuing to investigate this issue.

Jan 3, 11:52 PST
Update - Engineers are still working on the issue as it is intermittent.

Jan 3, 10:41 PST
Update - We are continuing to investigate this issue.

Jan 3, 10:00 PST
Investigating - We are investigating an issue on which some Exchange customers are experiencing 504, 500 errors and random slowness when fetching assets from Exchange, we will provide more information as soon as we can.
